author: mklement0
body:
## Summary of the new feature/enhancement

On Windows, you can create OS-session-wide virtual drive with the `subst.exe` utility; e.g., `subst T: C:\Temp` creates virtual drive `T:` whose root is `C:\Temp`.

`Get-PSDrive` is currently not aware of these drives, so its `.Root` property just reports the virtual drive's root itself rather than the underlying directory.

```powershell
# WISHFUL THINKING:
PS> subst T: C:\Temp; (Get-PSDrive T).Root
C:\Temp
```

Currently (PowerShell Core 7.1.0-rc.2), the output is `T:\`

Note: It is debatable whether `Convert-Path` should also resolve paths based on substituted drives to their underlying path - currently, it doesn't.
title: Improve Get-PSDrive support for substituted drives
